author: Kiza Jones
comment: The switch to being powered by grubhub has confirmed this is my very last time using EAT24. While still being powered by YELP, felt like EAT24 was for the customer. It was still a personal experience with the restaurant you were ordering from even with the middle man. Now its just a bunch of rude third party delivery drivers who dont deserve even the 10% tip. How infuriating is it to call the restaurant about a driver they have no control over..

author: Hank Muro
comment: Since the grub hub takeover the app is terrible!  Searching for restaurants feels cluttered and is littered with promoted restaurants that are all the way across town.  The categories are the same font and size as menu items,  and in general just less useful and appealing as the old style.

author: Erik Jones
comment: The rewrite of the interface sucks. More clicks, confusing and my order didn't make it to the restaurant after they said they pushed it three times. Why fix something that wasn't broken?

author: Prithvi Kumar
comment: The new GrubHub collaboration has eliminated every single Restaurant near my house that I loved and ordered from. WAY TO F**K YOUR APP UP!! LOSERS.

author: Grant Oakley
comment: Since "update" to GrubHub, I can no longer place orders. App either crashes or shows an error. My old orders are not compatible with the new app, some topping selections are no longer possible.

author: Big B
comment: Wit yelp out and GrubHub in, it's going downhill quick.  No more Google pay when checkout, yet in setup???   Confirmations and updates are not as good as before.  Shame, was my go to app...looking for others now.

author: Arsene Lahoud
comment: Yet another delivery service joined GrubHub and as a consequence does not support virtual credit card numbers! Not to be used it as your credit card info can be used as it is NOT secure

author: G M
comment: Interface is kludgy and not very user friendly.  This seems to be the case ,with every app, but the constant nagging to submit reviews and surveys is a pain in the ass, hence, the lower rating.

author: David Nina
comment: The new app is just a rebranded version of the grubhub app.  I cant see my past orders or find many of my favorite restaurants.

author: John D. Skerratt
comment: Worked perfectly until the last update. The restaurants I order from most are listed is closed through the app I have to go to the Eat24 website to place an order and it works just fine there. It worked great before this update

author: Lori Washbon
comment: Used to be so clean and smooth to use. Whoever designed your new UX should be bludgeoned.

author: Alee Wolfram
comment: The new layout is terrible and hard to use. Gives you ads for resturants that are all the way across town, ordering and paying is more difficult. Wish that they would have kept their old plan.

author: Charles DeBaufre
comment: The grub hub take over ruined this app.

author: REBECCA BENJAMIN
comment: I don't like the new UI.... looks just like door dash and grubhub which I was never a fan of. Too bad eat24 mimicked.

author: Amer Hillo
comment: Absolutely terrible since the grubhub update.

author: Filiberto Mera
comment: Update deleted my past orders now I have to start from zero again

author: Angela Bednar
comment: Never any issues with the app or customer support. Orders always go through.

author: Mo Arb
comment: Awesome app, couldn't ask for anything simpler. New update makes it even more straight forward 3/2/2018

author: Kyle Groft
comment: New update was a little confusing at first but I'm really enjoying it.

author: SUPER NITRO
comment: I don't like the new configuration

author: Joshua Alvarenga
comment: The app update is really cluttered

author: Kimiko Kusanagi
comment: When your hungry and don't feel like leaving the house this is perfect. Great service and fast.

author: Michelle Furgerson
comment: Much restaurant. Very food.

author: John Saunders
comment: Great app. They changed the UI but it was STILL easy to use. That's impressive (says the software guy)

author: f t
comment: Older version was better

author: Tony McKenzie
comment: Love the app but you guys really need to ditch all the bold fonts in the redesign.
It used to be better. They had better filter options and free delivery restaurants.

author: Chelsey Hageman
comment: Why did the app change? Was so much better before!!

author: delena charette
comment: Pretty easy to use and fast. Nice to have partnered with grubhub

author: Joy Smith
comment: Easy to use. Awesome restaurants.  Great, personable delivery drivers.

author: Shorty_ Goals.936
comment: Needs to expand to black areas

author: Stephanie Shelton
comment: Makes ordering easy !

author: Luis Delgado
comment: Great app

author: Brittney Biagi
comment: Really useful

author: Catina Washington
comment: Great Service

author: john smith
comment: Useful app

author: Alexander Warren
comment: Awesome

author: N d
comment: On multiple occasions, despite recirving confirmation emails that my order had been placed and my credit card had been charged the restaraunts never received an order. Aside from the numerous hours spent waiting on food that wasn't coming I had to then worry if my card had been charged for food I never received. When I try to contact support I get no answer. Service offered is not provided and support is non-existent. Do not use this app or you will waste time, patience, and potentially your money.

author: Tena DuBerry
comment: Placed order the sent email and text to call email or contact them to verify. Nobody came to the phone when I called. No one responded when I emailed. No one responded when I opened chat. Left several messages asking if confirmed or cancelled. Restaurant said it never received my order. Why have I been charged. Total waste of time. I would give them a zero if I could.

author: A Google User
comment: Constantly logs me out. Push notifications that I can't turn off (?). Annoying. It works eventually I guess but definitely needs improvement. Tried to submit comments through the website but the customer service response only came through on the app, which of course wasn't showing what my comment only what the rep was typing.
